description:
Fallback mechanism for oracle failure or indeterminate FSP.

Specifies a fallback final settlement price (FSP) that will be used
if the oracle has not provided a valid FSP by the fallback_time.
This prevents user collateral from being locked indefinitely.

Typically, fallback_time is set significantly after earliestFSPSubmissionTime
(e.g., weeks or months later) to ensure this mechanism is rarely activated.

fallback_fsp.description: Fallback final settlement price (decimal string, may be negative). Used if oracle fails to provide FSP by fallback_time. Must be within product price range [minPrice, maxPrice]. Examples: '0.5', '100.0', '-1.5'
fallback_fsp.title: Fallback Fsp

fallback_time.description: Fallback activation time (UTC datetime in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ). If oracle has not provided FSP by this time, fallback_fsp will be used. Must be significantly after earliestFSPSubmissionTime. Example: '2026-12-31T23:59:59Z'
fallback_time.title: Fallback Time
